episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a range of quirky and intriguing topics, including the role of visitors' breath in museum conservation, a gruesome tug of war accident in Taiwan, medieval election practices, and the surprising story behind the adoption of the American national anthem.

facts.fact: Museums need visitors' breath in order to preserve their exhibits properly.
In 1997, a mass tug of war went so badly wrong that it ripped two of the contestants' arms off.
In medieval elections, you were supposed to object to any suggestion that you wanted to win.
The reason America has a national anthem is down to Robert Ripley, believe it or not.
